title: Ibrahim Salim Saad
text:
Ibrahim Salim Saad (born 1972) is an <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>i international <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Club career.
In the 1990s he was playing in <a href="Lebanon">Lebanon</a>, before returning to Iraq where he played first in <a href="Salahaddin%20FC">Salahaddin FC</a> and, after one season, moved to <a href="Al-Talaba">Al-Talaba</a>. In the winter-break of the 2000–2001 season, Ibrahim went to <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> and played half a season in the <a href="Serbian%20First%20League">Second League</a> club <a href="FK%20Dubo%C4%8Dica">FK Dubočica</a> from <a href="Leskovac">Leskovac</a>, where he had 12 league appearances. In 2001, he signed for <a href="Arbil%20FC">Arbil FC</a>, before moving, in 2002 to <a href="Yemen">Yemen</a> to represent the capital <a href="Sana%27a">Sana'a</a> club <a href="Al-Wahda%20%28San%27a%27%29">Al-Wahda</a>.
International career.
Ibrahim Salim Saad was a part of the <a href="Iraq%20national%20football%20team">Iraq national football team</a>. Among others, he participated in the so-called <a href="Agony%20of%20Doha">Agony of Doha</a> match, held in <a href="Doha">Doha</a>, <a href="Qatar">Qatar</a> on 28 October 1993, between Iraq and Japan, It was a qualification game for the <a href="1994%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1994 FIFA World Cup</a>, that finished in a 2–2 draw, and in which Saad was the Iraqi goalkeeper. Unfortunately for him, Iraq ended up not qualifying. He also played in the same qualifiers against PR Korea <a href="Saudi%20Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a> and <a href="Iran">Iran</a>.
